content:
Heh - thanks for the mention. You forgot the IronPython-URLs blog though. ;-)

If the lack of attributes in IronPython makes it hard to use the 'in browser' Silverlight test runner, then maybe you need to prod Dino Veihland to add IP support for attributes. That would be *fantastic* as it is the glaring hole in the IronPython .NET integration.

Now that class decorators have made it into Python 2.6 there is no syntactic reason not to. :-)

(Running Silverlight tests in the browser is fantastic - great to see a focus on testing.)
Any word on whether Win Mobile 6.1 will support Silverlight 2?

wait, so you're holding out for the next release of WMobile and not the next model of iPhone which rumor has it will incorporate 3G (finally)?!??!
j/k

thanks for the links...
